description: From Latin eximius (“set apart, select”), from eximō (“take out or away; deliver, free”), from ex (“out of, from”) + emō (“buy; acquire, take”).

adjectives.description: eximious (comparative more eximious, superlative most eximious)

examples: You've read the death of Hercules,
But there the facts of his decease
Each schoolboy will at large recite
How that eximious man of might
